questions.question: What is the "appointed day" according to the Corruption Prevention Act?

options.a: January 1, 2001
options.c: June 1, 2001
options.d: December 1, 2001

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). (Traced back to Section 2(1). Corruption Prevention Act 2001)

questions.question: What does the term "public function" include according to the Act?

options.a: Activities performed only by government officials
options.b: Activities performed by private individuals
options.c: Activities performed by government officials, public or private bodies providing public services, and elected Members of the House of Representatives or Senate
options.d: Activities performed for financial gain only

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). (Traced back to Section 2(1). Corruption Prevention Act 2001)

questions.question: According to Section 14(1)(a), what constitutes an act of corruption by a public servant?

options.a: Accepting gifts or benefits for performing public functions
options.b: Failure to provide an explanation about disproportionate assets
options.c: Using classified information for personal gain
options.d: All of the above

questions.notes: The correct answer is (a). (Traced back to Section 14(1)(a). Corruption Prevention Act 2001)

questions.question: What is the penalty for a second or subsequent offense related to corruption according to Section 15(1)(b)?

options.a: A fine not exceeding one million dollars
options.b: Imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years
options.c: A fine not exceeding ten million dollars or imprisonment for a term not exceeding ten years or both
options.d: Imprisonment for a term not exceeding five years

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). (Traced back to Section 15(1)(b). Corruption Prevention Act 2001)

questions.question: Under what circumstances can a public servant be prosecuted for illicit enrichment according to the Act?

options.a: If he fails to declare his assets
options.b: If he fails to explain disproportionate assets to the Commission
options.c: If he fails to attend an inquiry by the Commission
options.d: If he fails to provide information required by the Commission

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). (Traced back to Section 14(5). Corruption Prevention Act 2001)

questions.question: What defense is available to a person charged with an offense of illicit enrichment according to the Act?

options.a: Proof of inheritance of assets
options.b: Proof of ownership of assets
options.c: Proof of financial stability
options.d: Proof of lawful means for acquiring assets

questions.notes: The correct answer is (a). (Traced back to Section 14(5A). Corruption Prevention Act 2001)

questions.question: What is the punishment for failing to furnish a statutory declaration to the Commission without reasonable cause, according to Section 15(2)(a)?

options.a: A fine not exceeding two hundred thousand dollars
options.b: Imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years
options.c: Both a fine not exceeding two hundred thousand dollars and imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years
options.d: A fine not exceeding one million dollars

questions.notes: The correct answer is (a). (Traced back to Section 15(2)(a). Corruption Prevention Act 2001)

questions.question: According to the Act, what is considered an act of corruption for an agent?

options.a: Accepting gifts only
options.b: Making false statements on behalf of the principal
options.c: Accepting gifts or consideration as an inducement for doing or forbearing to do any act related to the principal's affairs
options.d: Providing false information about the principal

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). (Traced back to Section 14(10)(a). Corruption Prevention Act 2001)

questions.question: Under what circumstances can a person apply for an order regarding property forfeiture according to the Act?

options.a: During the proceedings for the offense
options.b: Within a period of six months after the day on which a forfeiture order is made
options.c: Both a and b
options.d: Only a

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). (Traced back to Section 15(6). Corruption Prevention Act 2001)

questions.question: What does the Act define as "public function"?

options.a: Any activity performed by a government official
options.b: Any activity performed for financial gain
options.c: Any activity performed a single time or continually, whether or not payment is received therefor, which is carried out by a person for, or on behalf of or under the direction of a Ministry, Department of Government, a statutory body or authority, a Parish Council, the Kingston and St. Andrew Corporation or a government company; a body, whether public or private, providing public services; a Member of the House of Representatives or of the Senate in that capacity
options.d: Any activity performed by a Member of the House of Representatives or of the Senate

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). (Traced back to Section 2(1). Corruption Prevention Act 2001)

questions.question: What does the term "public servant" include according to the Act?

options.a: Only individuals employed in the public service of Jamaica
options.b: Individuals employed in the public, municipal, or parochial service of Jamaica, in the service of a statutory body or authority, or a government company, and those appointed, elected, selected, or otherwise engaged to perform a public function
options.c: Only elected Members of the House of Representatives or of the Senate
options.d: Individuals working for private companies providing public services

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). (Traced back to Section 2(1). Corruption Prevention Act 2001)

questions.question: According to Section 14(6)(a), what constitutes an act of corruption by a public servant?

options.a: Using classified information for personal benefit
options.b: Using property belonging to the Government or any statutory body, authority, or government company for personal benefit
options.c: Using any document or information obtained during the performance of duties for personal benefit
options.d: Accepting gifts or benefits for performing public functions

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). (Traced back to Section 14(6)(a). Corruption Prevention Act 2001)

questions.question: What happens if a public servant fails to explain the origin of assets disproportionate to his lawful earnings according to the Act?

options.a: He will be fined without imprisonment
options.b: He will be prosecuted for the offense of illicit enrichment
options.c: He will be demoted
options.d: He will be given a warning

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). (Traced back to Section 14(5). Corruption Prevention Act 2001)

questions.question: According to Section 15(3)(b), what can the court order if the property involved in corruption is situated outside Jamaica?

options.a: The property will be forfeited to the court
options.b: An amount equivalent to the value of such property, assessed as directed by the Court, will be paid by the public servant concerned to the Crown
options.c: The property will be returned to the accused
options.d: The property will be sold and the funds given to charity

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). (Traced back to Section 15(3)(b). Corruption Prevention Act 2001)

questions.question: What is considered a defense for a person charged with an offense of illicit enrichment according to the Act?

options.a: Proof of inheritance of assets
options.b: Proof of ownership of assets
options.c: Proof of financial stability
options.d: Proof of lawful means for acquiring assets

questions.notes: The correct answer is (d). (Traced back to Section 14(5A). Corruption Prevention Act 2001)

questions.question: What can a person do if they claim an interest in any property referred to in subsection (5) of Section 15?

options.a: Apply to the Commission
options.b: Apply to the Court
options.c: Apply to the Police
options.d: Apply to the Governor

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). (Traced back to Section 15(6). Corruption Prevention Act 2001)

questions.question: What is the punishment for knowingly giving false information at an inquiry conducted by the Commission under Section 7?

options.a: A fine not exceeding two hundred thousand dollars
options.b: Imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years
options.c: Both a fine not exceeding two hundred thousand dollars and imprisonment for a term not exceeding two years
options.d: A fine not exceeding one million dollars

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). (Traced back to Section 15(2)(d). Corruption Prevention Act 2001)

questions.question: According to Section 14(11), who does the term "agent" include?

options.a: Only lawyers representing individuals
options.b: Any person employed by or acting for another
options.c: Any government official
options.d: Only individuals involved in real estate transactions

questions.notes: The correct answer is (b). (Traced back to Section 14(12). Corruption Prevention Act 2001)

questions.question: Under what circumstances can a public servant be liable for prosecution in Jamaica for an act of corruption committed in another State?

options.a: If the act involves a large sum of money
options.b: If the act is particularly detrimental to the other State
options.c: If the act is specified in the Act and is committed in another State
options.d: If the act is committed against a government official in another State

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). (Traced back to Section 14(9). Corruption Prevention Act 2001)

questions.question: What does the Act consider as "document"?

options.a: Only written papers and photographs
options.b: Only written papers
options.c: Any written or visual material, including photographs, films, and electronic data
options.d: Only government-related documents

questions.notes: The correct answer is (c). (Traced back to Section 2(1). Corruption Prevention Act 2001)
